places_with_reviews.name: Sri Veera Venkata Sathyanarayana Swamy Vari Devasthanam Annavaram

reviews.text:
Except God everyone working here shows the discrimination. If you are VIP you gain special entry access to the temple. No proper mats placed on the steps or on the floor/road. So do not visit in Summer time. From entry to exit you have to pay money for every service.

Prasadam was very good. Must have.

A very good place Lots of belief is there
From all over country devotees pay a visit to this temple
Mainly Satyanarayan swamy Vratam
They participate with whole family members
Gokulam is there for Puja
Daily devotees can have their food
In temple free of cost
Marriages are held here

Annavaram is a temple town on the banks of the Pampa River. It is located in Kakinada district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. The village has the temple of Veera Venkata Satyanarayana, a form of Vishnu on the Ratnagiri Hill. It is 18 km away from Tuni city.

Weekdays are the best place to visit the temple and have the dharshan. It is very comfortable to make Sri Satyannarayana Swamy Vratham and have a speedy darshan. The temple is so good and the god as well. It is well maintained by the AP Temples Government.

It is a famous temple of lord satyanarayana swami.the temple is famous for marriages and Satya Narayana Swami vratam which is done to full fill our dreams many people visit this temple for this vratham .the temple is surrounded by natural scenaries.we can see the beautiful river pampa, ANNAVARAM is a beautiful religious place..there is a beautiful lake. Parking space is available.prasadam in this temple is sooo nice .

We did vratham in the temple, we bought 1500Rs ticket, for 1500rs ticket, pandith sit with you perform puja . 2000Rs ticket also same as 1500 but it is in AC room. Dont waste your money to buy fllowers maala at the hall entrance. You can buy coconuts and puja samagri for Rs 250. Other items will be provided in the temple. Vratham takes 1.5hrs to 2hrs to complete. You can buy 200Rs ticket inside the temple to enter garba gudi to see swamyy closely.

places_with_reviews.name: Sree Ganesh Residency
places_with_reviews.address: OPPOSITE TO UPHILL GHAT ROAD, Annavaram, Andhra Pradesh 533406, India

reviews.text:
Waste of money

Its really waste of money staying here.

we stayed for one day in 2 floor room no 22, its a smelly room washroom is too bad, No hot water, Tap will not work, bedsheets not changed. when we informed in reception he came up and said there is no smell and he cant give another room.
We have reached in the evening 6 Pm asked receptionist to switch on the greyser he denied to do it saying they will only switch it on the morning if you want to do bath wait till morning.

Clean and neat rooms. Parking not available, but devasthanam parking is there. Don't expect a professional service as this is not 5star hotel. But best budget hotel.
Owner and team were nice.
Very Good..... Nice location...very good staff...best rooms for low budget... And near by Temple...

We just stay for few hours and stay was good
Room was ok as we just need for refresh and luggage.
If you didn't get rooms in upside temple will recommend to try this hotel once.
It's quite opposite to Temple route.But rooms are not that much good.But it is ok to stay for few hours.Later we will suffucation and bad smell..due to no air flow

places_with_reviews.name: Swamy Vari Temple Gate Way, ANNAVARAM
places_with_reviews.address: 7CH2+GFH, Annavaram Town Rd, Annavaram, Andhra Pradesh 533406, India

reviews.text:
The Swami Vari Temple Gate in Annawaram, Andhra Pradesh, is a remarkable testament to devotion and architectural grandeur. Standing before it, I was immediately struck by its intricate design, combining traditional and contemporary elements in a way that captures the essence of the region's rich cultural heritage.

What makes this gate unique is its monumental scale; it's not just an entrance but a grand portal to spirituality. The ornate sculptures and vivid colors evoke a sense of celebration and religious significance. As you pass through, you're enveloped in an atmosphere of sanctity and tradition.

The gate's location in the heart of Annawaram adds to its charm, with a lively market and bustling streets that showcase the vibrancy of local life. The locals' warm hospitality and devotion are truly heartwarming, making it an immersive cultural experience.

Visiting the Swami Vari Temple Gate is not just a journey through architectural splendor but also a pilgrimage into the heart of Andhra Pradesh's spiritual and cultural heritage. It's a place where history and devotion merge, leaving an indelible impression on anyone who has the privilege to explore it. A must-visit for those seeking a unique cultural adventure.
October to February is the best time to visit Annavaram.

places_with_reviews.name: Vishnu Sadan

reviews.text:
Worst maintenance, worst service, wash basins are overflowing, bathrooms are bad and no water. No drinking water available anywhere near the building. Even the marriage halls smell very bad.

The temple management doesn't care about pilgrims and facilities. They just eat money.
#FreeTemples
It is a function hall at Vishnu Sadam among many different sized halls to cater to the needs of the people who would like to arrange for a marriage function.
Rooms and function hall is okay, but food supply is not available in hill area, Food is main  problem, transportation better u should use own vehicle

Nice place for marriage events, In this building more than 35 halls are available which can accommodate 50,100 and 200 based on room capacity.

Maintenance wise not upto the mark.

For catering services they only providing contact numbers who are tied up with the management.

Good...seems newly developing area in other hill at annavaram. I feel the marriage halls are very small n cannot accommodate more than 50. There is much scope for development at this place is a holy place for Hindus. I also see that the frequency of  devasthanam provided bus facility to this place is minimal.

places_with_reviews.name: Annavaram Aalaya Toranam

reviews.text:
Whoever going to Annavaram temple do carry cash,no online transaction accepted even card swipe not available,
Near temple only one ATM centre n no cash available over der also
It was so troublesome

It is famous place, especially marriages spot. For regarding any marriage you can book online for mandapam,you can notice a large fan nearly 5meters in diameter near to toranam, the view is too beautiful✨. Below the temple steps they sell delicious annavaram prasadham. You also notice annavaram project while going down in road path, nice spot for photo section. Be careful in turnings.
Oldest and famous temple in Andhra Pradesh

Aalaya thoranam is seen while entering the premises of Sree Veera Venkata Satyanarayana Swamy temple located on the Ratnagiri of Annavaram. This thoranam welcomes piligrims comming through stairs path of Ratnagiri. It is seen after Vana Durga temple in the stairs path.
There are rooms there but not management is not giving at night time

There is no word to describe the mental peace we get at this temple.
Ample parking is available at hill top.
Peaceful place and best to visit on week days as no resh
The temple is very peaceful and Auspicious, but shops near the temple will charge you almost double the price of any item.
